div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States Ninth Circuit
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus by Tom Sing
FILED IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. OCT 7 1904 A. REEVES AYRES, CLERK A.N. Moore DEP.
Sanders V. Sanders attys for Petitioner
United States of America, Ninth Circuit,
In the matter of the application of Ham Hung Wah, by Tom Sing, His guardian for a writ of habeas corpus

Upon reading and filing the petition of Ham Hung Wah, duly signed and verified, whereby it appears that he is illegally restrained of his liberty by Thomas K. Fisher, Chinese Inspector in Charge at Fort Townsend, in the State of Washington, and stating wherein the alleged inegality consists, wherefrom it appears that a writ of habeas corpus ought to issue; It is ORDERED that a writ of habeas corpus do issue out of and under the seal of the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Ninth Judicial Circuit, and under the seal thereof, directed to the said Thomas M. Fisher, Chinese Inspector aforesaid, commending him to have the body of the said Ham Hung Wah before teh Judge of the Circuit Court, sitting in and for the District of WashingtonMontana on the 15th day of October,1904 at four2 o'clock p.m. of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Ham Hung Wah, together with the time and cause of his detention, and that you have then and there the said writ.
C.H. Hanford Judge of the Circuit Court.
